extends Object

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ComponentManager.Component
      Base class for all game object components to attach to a game object.
      class  ComponentManager.ComponentType<T extends ComponentManager.Component> 
      static interface  ComponentManager.OnAttachListener
      Callback invoked when a Component is attached to a host.
      static interface  ComponentManager.OnDetachListener
      Callback invoked when a Component is detached to a host.

      • createComponent

        public <T extends ComponentManager.Component> T createComponent(Class<T> cls)

        Creates a Component of the given class.

        Type Parameters:
        T - component type.
        Parameters:
        cls - component class.
        Returns:
        component.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if given component class is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if component class has not been registered or no factory has been registered to create the component.

      • createComponent

        public <T extends ComponentManager.Component> T createComponent(Class<T> cls,
                                                                String prototype)

      • destroyComponent

        public <T extends ComponentManager.Component> void destroyComponent(T component)

        Destroys the given Component.

        Parameters:
        component - to destroy.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if component is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if component class has not been registered, the given component was created from an unregistered factory, or the component has not been detached from its game object.

      • getComponentTypeCount

        public int getComponentTypeCount()

        Gets the number of unique components that have been registered.

        Returns:
        number of distinct components.

      • getFactory

        public <T extends ComponentManager.Component> ComponentFactory<T> getFactory(Class<T> cls)

        Returns the ComponentFactory that produces the component of the given type.

        Type Parameters:
        T - kind of component.
        Parameters:
        cls - type.
        Returns:
        factory producing component.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if component class is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if component class has not yet been registered.

      • getType

        Retrieves the ComponentType assigned to the given Component class.

        Parameters:
        cls - component's class.
        Returns:
        assigned component type identifier.

      • isRegistered

        public <T extends ComponentManager.Component> boolean isRegistered(Class<T> cls)

        Checks if a component's class has been assigned a ComponentManager.ComponentType.

        Type Parameters:
        T - component's type.
        Parameters:
        cls - component's class.
        Returns:
        true if registered.

      • registerComponent

        public <T extends ComponentManager.Component> ComponentManager.ComponentType registerComponent(Class<T> cls)

        Records the Component's class as expected to be used and returns a ComponentType assigned to the component class.

        Type Parameters:
        T - component's type.
        Parameters:
        cls - component's class.
        Returns:
        component's type.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the class is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the class has already been registered or the given class object belongs to Component itself.

      • registerFactory

        public <T extends ComponentManager.Component> void registerFactory(ComponentFactory<T> factory)

        Records the factory responsible for producing components of the given class.

        Type Parameters:
        T - component's type.
        Parameters:
        factory - component producer.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the class or factory is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the component class has not yet been registered or the factory was created with a component type identifier assigned to a different component class.
        IllegalStateException - if the component class already has a registered factory.
